results.title: Simple demonstrations with magnetism
results.brief_description: Interesting demonstrations and experiments explain and illustrate the basic concepts of magnetism: magnets can produce a force, magnets have poles, magnets can make other magnets, and the earth is a magnet. Many of the experiments can be repeated in the classroom, while others use equipment not available in most schools.

results.title: Simple demonstrations with air
results.brief_description: Presentation of factual information about air. Demonstrates that air has weight, exerts pressure, and is compressible. Simple equipment, with the exception of the mercury barometer and the vacuum pump is used to demonstrate these facts.

results.title: Simple ceramics (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A fascinating demonstration of elementary ceramic work. Culminates in an ingenious use of domestic kitchen utensils to create an elaborate and attractive fruit bowl.

results.title: Simons War (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The story of Simon Western, the Welsh Guardsman who returned from the Faulklands war so badly burned that he was not expected to live.

results.title: Simone de Beauvoir
results.brief_description: Simone De Beauvoir, Jean-Paul Satre and their friends discuss the events and involvements that shaped her life and opinions - from the Spanish Civil War to the Paris Riots of 1968. Her lucid, perceptive observations on people and events of the last 50 years exhibit the formidable power of exhilarating intelligence.

results.title: Simon of the desert = Simon del desierto
results.creator_credit: Gustavo Alatriste, Gustavo Alatriste Pictures and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description: In the ancient Biblical lands, Saint Simon (Claudio Brook) has hoisted himself on an immense pillar and resolved to deny himself material pleasure in order to commute more faithfully with God. His zeal soon makes him famous throughout the desert lands, and priests and sinners arrive in the hope he will perform miracles for them. But all Simon wants is to be left alone. What’s worse, the vengeful and jealous Satan (Silvia Pinal) has no intention of letting Simon find a communication God denied her and she does everything in her power to tempt him away from Heaven. Luis Bunuel fled Franco’s Spain and went to Mexico where he continued to make gloriously subversive films that mocked the pieties of both the bourgeoisie and Catholicism. Bunuel’s Simon is a cruel ascetic miser who may love God but treats people, including his own mother, with harsh disdain. And it is Satan, mischievously played by the delightful Pinal, who is the real hero of this tale, her spiteful rage at God loving Jesus more than her making wickedly blasphemous sense. Satan gets her revenge when she transports Simon into the future and shows him a group of teenagers dancing to rock and roll: Christianity’s denial of the body does not conquer. Or does it? Bunuel’s surrealistic atheism is embedded in Catholicism’s rich source of imagery and ritual. “Simon of the Desert” is one of cinema’s supreme blasphemous jokes. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Simon Gray's Butley = Butley
results.creator_credit: Ely Landau, Harold Pinter, Ely Landau Organization and American Express Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “American Film Theater = The American Film Theatre Collection”.
Simon Gray’s screen adaptation of his play “Butley” which was originally produced on the West End Stage by Michael Codron and directed by Harold Pinter. Alan Bates (who won a Tony Award for this role on the stage) is outstanding as Butley, a university lecturer whose life is falling apart. This day-in-the-life drama, set in his work place (a small college office) gradually unfolds as his life unravels. Butley’s sharp verbal wit is relentless as is his need for a smoke and stiff drink - especially as his wife (Susan Engel) has left him for another man. His workmate and previous flatmate Joey (Richard O’Callaghan) is leaving him too to be with his boyfriend Reg (Michael Byrne). Confoundedly confrontational as he feels everyone is deserting him, Butley could be disliked by the viewer but there is a subtly to Bates’ performance that somehow makes him likeable beyond the verbal gymnastics and dishevelled exterior. Cast includes Jessica Tandy, Georgina Hale, Simon Rouse.

results.title: Simon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nargun and the stars”.
A television adaptation of Patricia Wrightson’s novel of the same name, this series is the story of Simon Brent, a 10 year old city boy who is placed in the care of country relatives when his parents are killed in a car crash. Simon finds life very boring until he explores a nearby swamp, where he experiences some odd happenings and finally meets a strange swamp creature called The Potkoorok. From that time on, life is considerably more exciting, mysterious and dangerous for Simon and his relatives, Charlie and Eddie, as they do battle with a menacing giant rock known as The Nargun.

results.title: Simon
results.creator_credit: Independent Cine Art, Anne Balfour Fraser and Hans Casparius
results.brief_description: Simon, a clumsy and slightly backward boy, joins his young playmates in their games in the woods, but is tormented and finally abandoned by them. In this experimental film, the children were given only a rough outline of each scene and themselves improvised the details. The central theme of bullying and group cruelty pinpoints a private purgatory familiar to every child. The beauty of the woodlands where the action takes place symbolises the supposedly innocent natures of children, stressing the disillusioning contrast with their behaviour.
